title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. what: Task Queue in R Based On PostgreSQL
title: Task Queue in R Based On PostgreSQL
text: Task Queue implemented R asynchronous tasks based PostgreSQL database. package suitable parallel computing without communication among parallel tasks (.e. Embarrassingly parallel).

what: Challenge of parallel computing in R
title: Task Queue in R Based On PostgreSQL
text: Several R packages using parallel computing (e.g. High-Performance Parallel Computing R suitable asynchronous tasks. Uneven load among cores/workers. workers run faster others wait others stop. utilise new available workers parallel task started. taskqueue designed utilise available computing resources tasks finished dynamic allocating tasks workers.

title: Task Queue in R Based On PostgreSQL
text: computing resource defined facility/computer can run multiple jobs/workers. new resource can added resource_add configurations. name resource name type resource type. support slurm stage host network name access resource nodename obtain Sys.info() resource workers maximum number available cores resource log_folder folder store log files resource Currently slurm supported although plan implement types resource. log_folder important troubleshooting split project. wouble better store high speed hard drive frequent /O process write log files.
code: resource_add(name = "hpc",              type = "slurm",              host = "hpc.example.com",              nodename = "hpc",             workers = 500,             log_folder = "/home/user/log_folder/")

title: Task Queue in R Based On PostgreSQL
text: taskqueue manages tasks project resources, working directory, runtime requirements configurations. project unique name can created project_add function assign common requirements (e.g. memory). Assign resource project can used schedule workers configurations (e.g. working directory, total runtimes, project specified workers). Now tasks can added database function task_add, e.g.  Now can develop function actually perform data processing, takes task id first argument, expect return values, save final output file system check whether task finished. Finally, call worker run wrapper function project name. developing testing wrapper function, can save file (e.g. rcode.R) schedule run following functions. Reset failed/working tasks idle status project_reset Start project allow workers consuming tasks project_start Schedule tasks resources (e.g. worker_slurm slurm cluster) Check task status task_status Stop project project_stop task four status idle: task running. working: task still running one worker. failed: task failed reason. Check log folder trouble shooting. finished: task finished without errors.
code: project_add("test_project", memory = 20) project_resource_add(project = "test_project",                       resource = "hpc") task_add(project, num = 100, clean = TRUE) library(taskqueue) fun_test <- function(i) {     # Check output file     out_file <- sprintf("%s.Rds", i)     if (file.exists(out_file)) {         return()     }     # Perform the actual computing     # ....          # Save final output     saveRDS(i, out_file) }  worker("test1", fun_test) # Reset status for all tasks in a project  project_reset("test1") # Start project project_start("test1") # Schedule task on slurm resource `hpc` worker_slurm("test1", "hpc", "rcode.R", modules = "sqlite/3.43.1") # Check status of all tasks task_status("test1") # Stop the project project_stop("test1")
